sentence.Network_cn: 他查看了一下收银机的抽屉，里面有钱。

phrase.cizu_name: have (或 with) one's fingers (或 hand) in the till

jx.jx_en_mean: used in reference to theft from one's place of work

lj.lj_ly: he was caught with his hand in the till and sacked.
lj.lj_ls: 他在单位行窃时被当场抓住并被解雇。

derivation.yuyuan_name: Old English til, of Germanic origin; related to Old Norse til 'to', also ultimately to till
late Middle English (in the general sense 'drawer or compartment for valuables'): of unknown origin

Old English tilian 'strive for, obtain by effort', of Germanic origin; related to Dutch telen 'produce, cultivate' and German zielen 'aim, strive', also ultimately to till. The current sense dates from Middle English
late 17th cent. (originally Scots, denoting shale): of unknown origin

entry.tran: (常于口语与非正式书面语中代替 until)
entry.def: In spoken English and informal written English, till is often used instead of until .

example.ex: They had to wait till Monday to ring the bank manager...
example.tran: 他们必须等到周一才能给银行经理打电话。

example.ex: I've survived till now, and will go on doing so without help from you.
example.tran: 我一直努力活到了现在，而且没有你的帮助也能继续活下去。

entry.tran: (商店等处的)现金出纳机，收银机
entry.def: In a shop or other place of business, a till is a counter or cash register where money is kept, and where customers pay for what they have bought.

example.ex: ...long queues at tills that make customers angry.
example.tran: 收银台前令顾客恼火的长队

entry.tran: (收银机中的)钱柜，放钱的抽屉
entry.def: A till is the drawer of a cash register, in which the money is kept.

example.ex: He checked the register. There was money in the till.
example.tran: 他查看了一下收银机的抽屉，里面有钱。

entry.def: When people till land, they prepare the earth and work on it in order to grow crops.

example.ex: Workers were singing as they tilled the rice paddy fields.
example.tran: 劳动者们一边耕犁稻田一边唱歌。

means.word_mean: 1. unstratified soil deposited by a glacier; consists of sand and clay and gravel and boulders mixed together
1. work land as by ploughing, harrowing, and manuring, in order to make it ready for cultivation;

Sentence.sentence: But till now, they've been something like a mirage（幻影）in the distance, more like a hazy（模糊的）dream than an actual reality.
Well, at 3:30, you're seeing our sales representative there and then you're free till the evening.
Well, I guess I'd sell my watch or computer or do some odd jobs till I could afford a return plane ticket.

However,while talking is largely subconscious and rapid, writing is deliberate and slow, Over time,writers took advantage of this and started crafting long-winded sentences such as this one:The whole engagement lasted above 12 hours, till the gradual retreat of the Persians was changed into a disorderly flight, of which the shameful example was given by the principal leaders and……" No one talks like that casually — or should
Not only does she have a tendency to be moody all the time, but she misses appointments, doesn't follow through on projects, and doesn't seem to plan anything till the last minute.
I try not to go online till my day's writing is finished, and I moved from Manhattan to rural Japan in part so I could more easily survive for long stretches entirely on foot.

sentences.en: Please wait for me till I come back.
I sat up till she came back.
I waited till they should return.
He will wait till I arrive.
He had hardly reached the station till the train arrived.
sentences.cn: 他刚到火车站, 火车就进站了。

sentences.en: It was not till 11 o'clock that he came back last night.

jushi.english: I kept standing in the scorching sun for a long time, till I fainted.
jushi.chinese: 我一直长时间地站在灼热的太阳下,终于昏倒了。

jushi.english: He had hardly reached the station till the train arrived.
jushi.chinese: 他刚到火车站,火车就进站了。

jushi.english: He did not come till I left the hotel.
jushi.chinese: 直到我离开旅馆他才来。
